primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Risen Christ overcomes human obstinacy and the limitations of physical sight to bestow the gift of faith upon Thomas and future generations.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus doesn’t let Thomas forget it
Jesus actually grants to Thomas the signs
Jesus meets him all the way and from beyond all the way
the Lord looks up and out... speaking to you and to me
Blessed are they who have not seen and yet have believed
the One who gives faith, who confirms faith, who brings faith to completion

ontvanger.identificatie: Thomas and the Future Believers (The Hearers)
tekstueel_bewijs: speaking to you and to me
entrusted with carrying that proclamation to the world
the word of this merely human witness
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (implied through the 'bond of trust')

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad mood but the 'ironbound' reality of death and the ontological inability of the human to believe without divine intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The preacher's personal journey from Easter depression to joy through the encounter with a fellow believer.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Preacher (Fleming Rutledge)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The personal anecdote serves as a 'micro-narrative' that mirrors the Thomas story, moving from 'not seeing' (empty streets) to 'seeing' (the usher) to 'believing' (proclamation).

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus doesn’t let Thomas forget it
Jesus meets him all the way
the Lord looks up and out... and utters
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We want to create our own conditions

voorbeelden: Thomas must have been very ashamed
We want to create our own conditions for faith
knowing that person’s heart better than he knew it himself
the only One who has ever come back victorious from the grave

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes Christ's power (Pouvoir) to overcome the human inability to believe. Faith is not a 'must' (Devoir) but a gift given to those who lack the power to see.

primaire_tegenstelling.niet_s2: The Appearance (Jesus coming through the door)

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Empty NYC) to ~S1 (Thomas's doubt) to ~S2 (The appearance) to S1 (The Beatitude for the hearer).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in Christ's proactive movement toward the doubter, which transforms ~S1 into S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death is depicted as 'mausoleums' and 'prisons'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. Jesus is the primary actor who initiates the encounter, speaks the words of grace, and creates the faith he requires.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus’ willingness to meet Thomas’s conditions exposes the disciple’s effrontery far more effectively than any rebuke

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the giver of faith
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the One who gives faith, who confirms faith, who brings faith to completion

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Thomas is not an example to follow, but a mirror of human helplessness whom Christ rescues.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Thomas (as a mirror of the hearer's doubt)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Thomas is the receiver of a grace he did not seek.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and assurance; the burden of 'producing' faith is removed.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The personal anecdote, the biblical narrative, and the contemporary application are perfectly fused through the actant of the 'Risen Lord'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the bond of trust between those who live in the presence of Christ today

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment of faith as a gift.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a 'locked door' or 'obstinacy' that only Christ can penetrate.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains a strict 'God-as-Subject' grammar, ensuring that the 'engine' of the message is the agency of the Risen Christ.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: None; POUVOIR is appropriately dominant for an Easter sermon.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ's appearance) correctly precedes and enables the secondary program (the Church's witness).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics, successfully shifting the hearer from a 'Subject' of their own faith to a 'Receiver' of Christ's blessing.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Broadway' imagery, semiotics reveals that the usher is a 'Helper' actant for the 'Subject' Christ.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond explaining John 20 to mapping the functional roles of the hearer in the ongoing narrative of the Resurrection.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'locked doors' are not just a setting but an 'Opponent' that Christ (Subject) overcomes to reach the Object (Thomas's heart).

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (appears, turns, singles out, speaks, grants, meets, looks, utters)
appendices.notities: The sermon effectively uses the 'Subject-switch' from the preacher's initial efforts to Christ's definitive action.
